title: Krypto-Oddsen

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Well there reputation here in the forum is already pretty bad for multiple scam report for not paying there customer here. They are already inactive and abandoned there ANN thread here since 2020 after users here created a flag against there multiple scam action. You can check there trust page for there Bitcointalk account here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=2815268Forum user is already staying away on that casino long time ago and it’s sad that you’re not paid for all your hard work.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Cyber.Bet has bad reputation in this forum. They are inactive, almost two years already. Check this scam accusation thread[1] about them. No doubt that even if you are an affiliate or a user chance that you will faced an issue is high.[1] CYBER BET IS REALLY [SCAMMING ME]!

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Nothing suprise with multiple scam assumtion.And more non-sense about this, first time to see "Self-blocked" rules to not paying referral income. As we know, referral income is nothing to do with "Blocked" account unless the account is owned by the upline.We all know, referral income is based on waggering.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Even on the trustpilot website there are a lot of negative reviews in the accusation of scam for cyber.bet, positive reviews are probably paid for by the casino itself, so this is a casino without a reputation and I don't see anything surprising in what happened to OP.There is also a thread on the forum accusing cyber.bet  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5261029.0

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Quote from: Daltonik on September 29, 2022, 05:06:00 PM-snip-A little bit advice.Never trusted from "Trust Pilot" review, there has some service who can boost you with a good positive review. That's why, I never trusted any review from TrustPilot better from a forum like bitcointalk.How they response and how the issue is on-going.

comments.author: smartaction
comments.body: Cyber.bet have a bad reputation on this forum seance 2020 and there forum account got red trust and still open red flag on there profile. and they are considered as scam site. So I don't think discussing  about it now can be bring anything good . Because a scam accusations was opened against it more than 2 years ago

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: I would have to agree with the other posters in this thread, unfortunately. You should have done some minimal amount of research. Had you done so then you would know that Cyber.Bet already has quite a bad reputation. It would have taken you 2 seconds to google the words "cyber.bet" and "scam". The first search result would have yielded bitcointalk and it would have linked to the scam reputation it has built for itself on this forum.I see such topics and things almost everday on the gambling subforum and 99% of it could have been avoided with a simple 5 minute research on the online gambling casino in question. Next time DYOR. I doubt they will give you the money. Best to move on.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Well, thanks for the shared information then. Everything comes to an end and cyber.bet was just one of the many that have good reputation first then went pretty bad at the end. I think you should move this topic on Scam Accusation board since it's more appropriate there, will report this to the mods if you don't know how to move it.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: Krypto-Oddsen on September 29, 2022, 02:30:21 PMSituation:We had a player from xxxxx register via our site. Our commission of 808 Euro suddenly disappeared. This happened in May this year. Fortunately, we have documented screenshots before the information disappeared on Aff. the panel of Cyber.betI do not read the TOS of the scam casino and I also do not know if they have or do not have the right not to pay the commission in case someone closes the account, but something I can not understand Is the following: to what I see you have a Review site and this casino has already complained since 2020, so how did you not see that they have already had complaints since 2020? Do you constitute analyze with some frequency each casino listed on your site? Because it seems that you didn't have this problem of not being paid commission, the casino would still be listed on your site and you would consider them as a good casino and meanwhile more people would be stolen by themAnother question that in a way does not have much to do with this problem but I want to take the question:Why do I only saw cloudbet in your casino and there are no other good casinos that are here on the forum?

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: Krypto-Oddsen on September 29, 2022, 07:22:39 PMIf a player has problems with withdrawals, etc., they contact us, if it turns out that the person registered through our links. We provide *that little extra service*.Looking at the method of how you work, I wonder the following:How many sites have already become scam and you are one of the first to know that the site became scam?Because I think there are few people who will create account in a casino using your site and remember that they created account on your site when they have withdrawal problems, most people do not even remember where they found Casino X or Z. So your method Is kind of strange.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: What casino are we talking about exactly? The Cyber.Bet announcement thread leads to a non-existing site. This one: https://cyber-bet.net/. But there is also https://cyber.bet/en/. I am not sure if that is a new domain or if they are completely unassociated platforms. Quote from: Krypto-Oddsen on September 29, 2022, 04:04:38 PMAnother issue is that it is an incredible shame that many credible online casino reviewers, without mentioning the names, still market this crypto casino. A little responsibility and benevolence must be shown. Credibility is hard to find if you are getting paid to post reviews. Not just in the crypto casino sphere but in general. There are even worse casinos than Cyber.bet, but they pay loads of money for marketing, and even run signature campaigns on this forum. Review sites post nice things about those who pay them. That's just the way it is. Quote from: Slow death on September 29, 2022, 07:09:25 PMI do not read the TOS of the scam casino and I also do not know if they have or do not have the right not to pay the commission in case someone closes the account... The TOS would indeed be a good place to start. @Krypto-Oddsen did you study them properly to see if they have a rule that allows them to cancel your commission earnings if players are self-blocked?

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Krypto-Oddsen on September 29, 2022, 07:22:39 PM<cut>Without a representative, we put a question mark. Therefore, our number one rule is always applicable: When the casino does not work with its partners, what about its own players?It's hard to trust a review site where the criteria is based on your relationship with the casino as their affiliate rather than the actual player experiences. I think the saddest part about the whole situation is the fact that you have no problem promoting some shady casinos that hardly have any positive reviews and are preying on the naive and inexperienced players that fall for their tout ads and end up losing money, yet you turn your back on them when it comes to your affiliate scheme and your commission. Don't you think that's the epitome of hypocrisy? How unprofessional can you be? While I don't know what the situation is with Cyber.bet, if I recall correctly, you were perfectly happy promoting scam sites like 1XBET, 1xBit, and 888starz, and you only reluctantly removed them in response to community pressure. It seems like you still have the same mentality even now, and you don't really care whether or not the players are cheated or ripped off.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.created_time: September 30, 2022, 11:52:16 PMLast edit: October 01, 2022, 10:47:21 AM by khaled0111
comments.body: Quote from: Krypto-Oddsen on September 29, 2022, 04:04:38 PMAnother issue is that it is an incredible shame that many credible online casino reviewers, without mentioning the names, still market this crypto casino. A little responsibility and benevolence must be shown.What's incredible is that you acknowledge how influencing this forum is but you chose to ignore the flag and the open scam accusations against that casino posted here and you continued to promote them. And now, when they (scammed you), refused to pay you for referring someone who is not going to make any deposit, you come here to complain and call other competitors all sorts of names for doing the same thing you were doing!Don't you think you are being a little hypocrite here?If cyber.bet has've paid you the 800 bucks you claim they owe you, am sure you wouldn't have created this thread.Sorry if I sound harsh!

comments.author: Krypto-Oddsen
comments.created_time: October 10, 2022, 09:28:43 AMLast edit: October 10, 2022, 10:00:31 AM by Krypto-Oddsen
comments.body: Happy Monday everyone.We think this forum post of ours went completely off track, so we choose to remove the forum, even though our case is not resolved.It becomes too much of an attack, even when our intention was to warn. Because the number one rule is when the admin in the casino doesn't work with their partners, what about players?What do we know about casinos operating unethically, scam, badly etc.? Remember that 9/10 online casinos have some kind of problem with their players. You can't go one by one without including them in your review. Even Bet365, William Hill and other giants have some kind of problem with their players, as you can read on Trustpilot and other sites. Then there will be absolutely no casinos to review. Of course, we do research, but everything depends on the degree of severity that we together in the team assess in each individual case.But we have seen, for example, that 1xbet, 888starz and 1xslots were among the most brutal casinos that had a very bad reputation on this forum and other gambling discussion forums. So we removed them from our review.The fact that we provide *the little extra service* to the player who should have challenges with the casino is a coincidence. When someone contacts us by e-mail, we do not ignore them and try to find a solution by contacting manager at the casino and explaining the situation. It goes without saying about customer service. This is, for example, how Askgamblers and Casino.guru and other big review giants work!?That certain forum users write: *If you had received the commission, you would not have given this warning*We think we have hit the wrong target group in this forum, as we are primarily Norway including Scandinavia and western countries, and choose to leave this forum.Thank you for taking the time to reply.BrAnders Digital Content Producer -  Krypto-Oddsen.com
